content.question: Over the time interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 4 hours, the air temperature is a constant 32oF. At time t=0, the wind velocity is v=20 mph. If the wind velocity increases at a constant rate of 5 mph per hour, what is the rate of change of the wind chill with respect to time at t=3 hours? Indicate units of measure.

frqParts.text: Over the time interval 0 ≤ t ≤ 4 hours, the air temperature is a constant 32oF. At time t=0, the wind velocity is v=20 mph. If the wind velocity increases at a constant rate of 5 mph per hour, what is the rate of change of the wind chill with respect to time at t=3 hours? Indicate units of measure.

topic.text: 4.1: Interpreting the Meaning of the Derivative in Context

skill.text: Skill 3.F: Explain the meaning of mathematical solutions in context.
